action.action-desc: Mr. Johnson of Georgia introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To provide an increased Federal capability for civil investigations and litigation, regarding alleged police, prosecutorial, or judicial misconduct, under section 210401 the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Police Agency Investigation Improvement Act of 2015.

section.header: Increased Federal capability for civil investigations and litigation, regarding alleged police, prosecutorial, or judicial misconduct, under section 210401 the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994
section.text: Section 210401 of the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994 (42 U.S.C. 14141) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Increased capability for civil investigations and litigation regarding alleged police, prosecutorial, or judicial misconduct

paragraph.text: For the purpose of investigations and litigation under this section regarding alleged police, prosecutorial, or judicial misconduct, the Attorney General shall create within the Special Litigation Section of the Civil Rights Division of the Department of Justice an Office of Police Agency Investigations.

For fiscal year 2016 and each of the succeeding 4 fiscal years, there are authorized to be appropriated $25,000,000 for investigations and litigation under this section regarding alleged police, prosecutorial, or judicial misconduct.

subsection.text: Section 1701 of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 (42 U.S.C. 3796dd(b)), as amended by this Act, is further amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Availability of additional funds To address police, prosecutorial, and judicial misconduct

paragraph.text: A recipient of a grant under this section that is subject to a judgment or a consent decree pursuant to an action brought by the Attorney General under section 210401 of the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994 (42 U.S.C. 14141) regarding alleged police, prosecutorial, or judicial misconduct may submit to the Attorney General an application to receive additional funds under this subsection at such time, and containing such information as the Attorney General may reasonably require.
Any amount received under this subsection shall be used to comply with such judgment or consent decree.

A grant of additional funds made under this subsection shall be in an amount that is equal to not more than 50 percent of the amount of the grant that the recipient otherwise receives under this section.
There is authorized to be appropriated $25,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2016 through 2020 to carry out this subsection.
